availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Crawford Hart Barkley (Jefferson County, Kentucky, collector, pension agent, and notary public)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, collector, pension agent, and notary public. Kentucky native. Son of James Chambers Barkely and Rebecca Hart Barkley. Married to Elizabeth Best Barkley. Father of R. B. Barkley, Mary Barkley, and Elizabeth Barkley. Married to Catherine Frances Reddish Barkley in Franklin County, Kentucky, on January 2, 1856. Father of Frances Barkley, John C. Barkley, Joseph F. Barkley, James Hickman Barkley, and George Marshall Barkley. Collector in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Pension agent in Louisville, Jefferson County in 1860. Notary public in Jefferson County.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 133A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 1, p. 24-5.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, La Grange, p. 42B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994043, Franklin County Marriages.
R. Burnham Moffat, The Barclays of New York: Who They Are and Who They Are Not, and Some Other Barclays, (New York: Robert Grier Cooke, Publisher, 1904), pp. 302, 310-11.
